name: backendFinal
description: I had to use express, mySQL, and node for a backend final project when I was studying at Bay Valley Tech. I learned how to use middleware in Express such as cors and JWT

name: brewery
description: Casey Reyes and I worked on a brewery locator app during our React Apprenticeship, we used React, React Router, Pigeon maps and a brewery API to do so.

name: number
description: For my first project in the React Apprenticeship, I made a number guessing game. I learned how to pass props and map through arrays to create buttons and other Html items with JSX.

name: weather
description: I used React in my React Apprenticeship to create a weather app, I used the open weather api. In this project I learned about Context, Redux, Styled Components, Error Handling, and Prop Types in React.

name: media
description: During the React Apprenticeship we had a month or two of free time between projects, so I wanted to work on creating a Facebook clone, I used React and Firebase to do so. I added Redux into my project, React Router, Styled Components to get the project working, I was able to let users create, delete, update posts, comment under posts, and I was working on a messaging system as well.

name: directory
description: Ermias and I worked together in our React Apprenticeship to create a student directory. We learned how to filter through arrays, add objects to arrays, and we were working on trying to implement Firebase as well, but we used local storage temporarily.
